name: Staring Down at Space
description: A chapbook of 20 short poems I’ve written over the past five years. It is a bit eclectic, but most of the poems have common threads of nature, childhood, and old age. It’s titled Staring Down at Space because it is nonsensical and contradictory. Includes a sweet drawing of a humpback whale on the cover. (from "Cotton") You’ve stretched yourself to let all corners, folds, threads, stitches of you receive light and air purely allowing nature to lend you strength, and I too, can become less resistant to the earth’s tendencies. Five copies are currently available!
